2025-12-27 19:24:39.510 | DEBUG    | metagpt.provider.base_llm:aask:205 - [{'role': 'system', 'content': '\n\nYou are a Team Leader, named Mike, your goal is Manage a team to assist users.  The current time is 2025-12-27 19:24:39.\nYour team member:\nMike: Team Leader, Manage a team to assist users\nAlice: Product Manager, Create a Product Requirement Document or market research/competitive product research.\nBob: Architect, design a concise, usable, complete software system. output the system design.\nAlex: Engineer, Take on game, app, web development and deployment.\nDavid: DataAnalyst, Take on any data-related tasks, such as data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, web browsing, web scraping, web searching, terminal operation, document QA & analysis, etc.\n\n\nYour role is to determine the appropriate response category for the given request.\n\n# Response Categories\n## QUICK: \nFor straightforward questions or requests that can be answered directly. This includes common-sense inquiries, legal or logical questions, basic math, short coding tasks, multiple-choice questions, greetings, casual chat, daily planning, and inquiries about you or your team.\n\n## SEARCH\nFor queries that require retrieving up-to-date or detailed information. This includes time-sensitive or location-specific questions like current events or weather. Use this only if the information isn\'t readily available.\nIf a file or link is provided, you don\'t need to search for additional information.\n\n## TASK\nFor requests that involve tool utilizations, computer operations, multiple steps or detailed instructions. Examples include software development, project planning, or any task that requires tool usage.\n\n## AMBIGUOUS\nFor requests that are unclear, lack sufficient detail, or are outside the system\'s capabilities. Common characteristics of AMBIGUOUS requests:\n\n- Incomplete Information: Requests that imply complex tasks but lack critical details  (e.g., "Redesign this logo" without specifying design requirements).\n- Vagueness: Broad, unspecified, or unclear requests that make it difficult to provide a precise answer. \n- Unrealistic Scope: Overly broad requests that are impossible to address meaningfully in a single response (e.g., "Tell me everything about...").\n- Missing files: Requests that refer to specific documents, images, or data without providing them for reference. (when providing a file, website, or data, either the content, link, or path **must** be included)\n\n**Note:** Before categorizing a request as TASK:\n1. Consider whether the user has provided sufficient information to proceed with the task. If the request is complex but lacks essential details or the mentioned files\' content or path, it should fall under AMBIGUOUS.\n2. If the request is a "how-to" question that asks for a general plan, approach or strategy, it should be categorized as QUICK.\n\n\n# Example\n\n1. Request: "How do I design an online document editing platform that supports real-time collaboration?"\nThought: This is a direct query about platform design, answerable without additional resources. \nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n2. Request: "What\'s the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning in machine learning?"\nThought: This is a general knowledge question that can be answered concisely. \nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n3. Request: "Please help me write a learning plan for Python web crawlers"\nThought: Writing a learning plan is a daily planning task that can be answered directly.\nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n4. Request: "Can you help me find the latest research papers on deep learning?"\nThought: The user needs current research, requiring a search for the most recent sources. \nResponse Category: SEARCH.\n\n5. Request: "Build a personal website that runs the Game of Life simulation."\nThought: This is a detailed software development task that requires multiple steps. \nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n6. Request: "Summarize this document for me."\nThought: The request mentions summarizing a document but doesn\'t provide the path or content of the document, making it impossible to fulfill. \nResponse Category: AMBIGUOUS.\n\n7. Request: "Summarize this document for me \'/data/path/docmument.pdf\'." \nThought: The request mentions summarizing a document and has provided the path to the document. It can be done by reading the document using a tool then summarizing it.\nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n8. Request: "Optimize this process." \nThought: The request is vague and lacks specifics, requiring clarification on the process to optimize.\nResponse Category: AMBIGUOUS.\n\n9. Request: "Change the color of the text to blue in styles.css, add a new button in web page, delete the old background image."\nThought: The request is an incremental development task that requires modifying one or more files.\nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': '[Message] from User to Mike: \n\nBased on the following use case, write a complete program in Java. The current task in the plan is for Alice to create the PRD.\nExplanation: "I attempted to locate historical records containing \'send to [<all>]\', and discovered an entry stating \'PRD is finished and masked.\' This indicates that Alice\'s task has been completed.\n```json\n[\n    {\n        "command_name": "Plan.finish_current_task",\n        "args": {}\n    },\n]\n```\n\n\n# Instruction\nYou are a team leader, and you are responsible for drafting tasks and routing tasks to your team members.\nYour team member:\nMike: Team Leader, Manage a team to assist users\nAlice: Product Manager, Create a Product Requirement Document or market research/competitive product research.\nBob: Architect, design a concise, usable, complete software system. output the system design.\nAlex: Engineer, Take on game, app, web development and deployment.\nDavid: DataAnalyst, Take on any data-related tasks, such as data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, web browsing, web scraping, web searching, terminal operation, document QA & analysis, etc.\n\nYou should NOT assign consecutive tasks to the same team member, instead, assign an aggregated task (or the complete requirement) and let the team member to decompose it.\nWhen drafting and routing tasks, ALWAYS include necessary or important info inside the instruction, such as path, link, environment to team members, because you are their sole info source.\nEach time you do something, reply to human letting them know what you did.\nWhen creating a new plan involving multiple members, create all tasks at once.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress based on team member feedback message, and update plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nYou should use TeamLeader.publish_team_message to team members, asking them to start their task. DONT omit any necessary info such as path, link, environment, programming language, framework, requirement, constraint from original content to team members because you are their sole info source.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to the user directly, DON\'T ask your team members.\nPay close attention to messages from team members. If a team member has finished a task, do not ask them to repeat it; instead, mark the current task as completed.\nNote:\n1. If the requirement is a pure DATA-RELATED requirement, such as web browsing, web scraping, web searching, web imitation, data science, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, text-to-image etc. DON\'T decompose it, assign a single task with the original user requirement as instruction directly to Data Analyst.\n2. If the requirement is developing a software, game, app, or website, excluding the above data-related tasks, you should decompose the requirement into multiple tasks and assign them to different team members based on their expertise. The standard software development process has four steps: creating a Product Requirement Document (PRD) by the Product Manager -> writing a System Design by the Architect -> creating tasks by the Project Manager -> and coding by the Engineer. You may choose to execute any of these steps. When publishing message to Product Manager, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n2.1. If the requirement contains both DATA-RELATED part mentioned in 1 and software development part mentioned in 2, you should decompose the software development part and assign them to different team members based on their expertise, and assign the DATA-RELATED part to Data Analyst David directly.\n2.2. For software development requirement, estimate the complexity of the requirement before assignment, following the common industry practice of t-shirt sizing:\n - XS: snake game, static personal homepage, basic calculator app\n - S: Basic photo gallery, basic file upload system, basic feedback form\n - M: Offline menu ordering system, news aggregator app\n - L: Online booking system, inventory management system\n - XL: Social media platform, e-commerce app, real-time multiplayer game\n - For XS and S requirements, you don\'t need the standard software development process, you may directly ask Engineer to write the code. Otherwise, estimate if any part of the standard software development process may contribute to a better final code. If so, assign team members accordingly.\n3.1 If the task involves code review (CR) or code checking, you should assign it to Engineer.\n4. If the requirement is a common-sense, logical, or math problem, you should respond directly without assigning any task to team members.\n5. If you think the requirement is not clear or ambiguous, you should ask the user for clarification immediately. Assign tasks only after all info is clear.\n6. It is helpful for Engineer to have both the system design and the project schedule for writing the code, so include paths of both files (if available) and remind Engineer to definitely read them when publishing message to Engineer.\n7. If the requirement is writing a TRD and software framework, you should assign it to Architect. When publishing message to Architect, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n8. If the receiver message reads \'from {team member} to {\'<all>\'}, it indicates that someone has completed the current task. Note this in your thoughts.\n9. Do not use the \'end\' command when the current task remains unfinished; instead, use the \'finish_current_task\' command to indicate completion before switching to the next task.\n10. Do not use escape characters in json data, particularly within file paths.\n11. Analyze the capabilities of team members and assign tasks to them based on user Requirements. If the requirements ask to ignore certain tasks, follow the requirements.\n12. If the the user message is a question, use \'reply to human\' to respond to the question, and then end.\n13. Instructions and reply must be in the same language.\n14. Default technology stack is Vite, React, MUI, Tailwind CSS. Web app is the default option when developing software. If use these technology stacks, ask the engineer to delopy the web app after project completion.\n15. You are the only one who decides the programming language for the software, so the instruction must contain the programming language.\n16. Data collection and web/software development are two separate tasks. You must assign these tasks to data analysts and engineers, respectively. Do not run the code, just save it.\n\n\nNo Plan \n\n\n# Current Task\n\n\n# Response Language\nyou must respond in English.\n\nPay close attention to the Example provided, you can reuse the example for your current situation if it fits.\nIf you open a file, the line number is displayed at the front of each line.\nYou may use any of the available commands to create a plan or update the plan. If your completed task matches the current, consider it finished.\nUsing Editor.insert_content_at_line and Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once in the current command list is forbidden. 2025-12-27 19:27:06.272 | INFO     | metagpt.utils.cost_manager:update_cost:59 - Total running cost: $0.001 | Max budget: $3.000 | Current cost: $0.000, prompt_tokens: 3020, completion_tokens: 1831total_token: $57874.000
2025-12-27 19:27:06.275 | INFO     | metagpt.roles.di.role_zero:_act:294 - Commands outputs: 
Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertBanner_1766834679/InsertBannerApp.java has been successfully created, with content:
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
import java.net.URL;
import java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException;
import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
import java.io.IOException;

/**
 * Main class for InsertBanner application.
 * Simulates the flow of inserting a banner for a restaurant point.
 * Handles authentication, image selection, validation, and insertion.
 */
public class InsertBannerApp {
    
    // Simulate server connection state
    private static boolean isServerConnected = true;
    
    /**
     * Main method - entry point of the application.
     * @param args Command line arguments
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== Insert Banner Application ===");
        
        // Create necessary objects
        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
        
        // Entry condition: Operator must be authenticated
        if (!authenticateOperator(scanner)) {
            System.out.println("Authentication failed. Exiting application.");
            scanner.close();
            return;
        }
        
        // Create restaurant point (maximum 3 banners for demo)
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(3);
        
        // Create banner manager
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        
        // Create operator
        Operator operator = new Operator("operator123");
        
        System.out.println("Authentication successful. Welcome, " + operator.getOperatorId());
        
        boolean continueOperation = true;
        
        while (continueOperation) {
            // Step 1: Select feature for insertion of new banner
            System.out.println("\n1. Insert new banner");
            System.out.println("2. View existing banners");
            System.out.println("3. Exit");
            System.out.print("Select option: ");
            
            int choice;
            try {
                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a number.");
                continue;
            }
            
            switch (choice) {
                case 1:
                    insertBannerFlow(operator, restaurantPoint, bannerManager, scanner);
                    break;
                case 2:
                    displayBanners(restaurantPoint);
                    break;
                case 3:
                    continueOperation = false;
                    System.out.println("Exiting application.");
                    break;
                default:
                    System.out.println("Invalid option. Please try again.");
            }
        }
        
        scanner.close();
        System.out.println("Application terminated.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates operator authentication.
     * @param scanner Scanner for user input
     * @return true if authentication successful, false otherwise
     */
    private static boolean authenticateOperator(Scanner scanner) {
        System.out.println("\n--- Authentication Required ---");
        System.out.print("Enter operator ID: ");
        String operatorId = scanner.nextLine();
        System.out.print("Enter password: ");
        String password = scanner.nextLine();
        
        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)
        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && 
            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }
    
    /**
     * Main flow for inserting a banner.
     * Follows the use case steps exactly.
     * @param operator The authenticated operator
     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added
     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic
     * @param scanner Scanner for user input
     */
    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, 
                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {
        System.out.println("\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");
        
        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection
        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");
        
        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)
        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");
        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();
        
        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)
        if (!checkServerConnection()) {
            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");
            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");
            return;
        }
        
        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners
        try {
            // Create a banner object with the selected image
            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());
            
            // Validate image characteristics
            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {
                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");
                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");
                return;
            }
            
            // Check maximum banners condition
            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {
                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + 
                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");
                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");
                return;
            }
            
            // Ask for confirmation
            System.out.println("\nBanner details:");
            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());
            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");
            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());
            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");
            
            System.out.print("\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");
            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();
            
            // Step 5: Confirm operation
            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {
                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");
                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");
                return;
            }
            
            // Step 6: Insert the banner
            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);
            
            if (success) {
                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");
                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");
            } else {
                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");
            }
            
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());
            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());
            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.
     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point
     */
    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {
        System.out.println("\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");
        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();
        
        if (banners.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No banners found.");
        } else {
            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {
                Banner banner = banners.get(i);
                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + 
                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +
                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");
            }
        }
        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + 
                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates checking server connection.
     * In a real application, this would ping the server.
     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise
     */
    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {
        // Simulate server connection check
        if (!isServerConnected) {
            return false;
        }
        
        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures
        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo
            isServerConnected = false;
            return false;
        }
        
        return true;
    }
    
    /**
     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).
     */
    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {
        isServerConnected = false;
    }
    
    /**
     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).
     */
    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {
        isServerConnected = true;
    }
}

Insert new banner");\n            System.out.println("2. View existing banners");\n            System.out.println("3. Exit");\n            System.out.print("Select option: ");\n            \n            int choice;\n            try {\n                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a number.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case 1:\n                    insertBannerFlow(operator, restaurantPoint, bannerManager, scanner);\n                    break;\n                case 2:\n                    displayBanners(restaurantPoint);\n                    break;\n                case 3:\n                    continueOperation = false;\n                    System.out.println("Exiting application.");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid option. Please try again.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        scanner.close();\n        System.out.println("Application terminated.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates operator System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': '\n# Past Experience\n<experience>\n\n# Tool State\nThe current editor state is:\n(Current directory: /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertBanner_1766834679)\n(Open file: None)\n\n# Current Plan\n[GOAL] [Message] from Mike to Alex: Based on the provided use case, write a complete program in Java. System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the main class InsertBannerApp.java. System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". Please enter a number.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case 1:\n                    insertBannerFlow(operator, restaurantPoint, bannerManager, scanner);\n                    break;\n                case 2:\n                    displayBanners(restaurantPoint);\n                    break;\n                case 3:\n                    continueOperation = false;\n                    System.out.println("Exiting application.");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid option. System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the main class InsertBannerApp.java. System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n                            " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". ", "signature": "(query: str, path: Union[str, pathlib.Path]) -> List[str]", "parameters": "Args: query (str): The search query string to look for in the indexed files. path (Union[str, Path]): A pathname or filename to search within. Example: >>> query = \\"The problem to be analyzed from the document\\" >>> file_or_path = \\"The pathname or filename you want to search within\\" >>> texts: List[str] = await Editor.similarity_search(query=query, path=file_or_path) >>> print(texts)"}, "write": {"type": "function", "description": "Write the whole content to a file. /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n     if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the main class InsertBannerApp.java. advertisement for a restaurant point.\n * Contains image metadata and validation logic.\n */\npublic class Banner {\n    private String imagePath;\n    private long size; // in bytes\n    private String uploadedBy;\n    private Date uploadDate;\n    private String imageType; // e.g., "jpg", "png"\n    private int width;\n    private int height;\n    \n    // Maximum allowed image size (5MB)\n    private static final long MAX_IMAGE_SIZE = 5 * 1024 * 1024;\n    \n    // Allowed image types\n    private static final String[] ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES = {"jpg", "jpeg", "png", "gif"};\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a banner.\n     * @param imagePath Path or URL to the image\n     * @param uploadedBy ID of the operator who uploaded the image\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if imagePath is null or empty\n     */\n    public Banner(String imagePath, String uploadedBy) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Image path cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        if (uploadedBy == null || uploadedBy.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Uploader ID cannot be null or empty.");\n        }\n        \n        this.imagePath = imagePath;\n        this.uploadedBy = uploadedBy;\n        this.uploadDate = new Date();\n        \n        // Simulate image properties (in real app, these would be extracted from the image)\n        this.size = (long) (Math.random() * 4 * 1024 * 1024) + 1024; // 1KB to 4MB\n        this.imageType = extractImageType(imagePath);\n        this.width = 800; // default width\n        this.height = 600; // default height\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Extracts image type from the file path.\n     * @param imagePath The path to the image\n     * @return The image extension (lowercase) or "unknown" if not found\n     */\n    private String extractImageType(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return "unknown";\n        }\n        \n        int lastDotIndex = imagePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < imagePath.length() - 1) {\n            return imagePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1).toLowerCase();\n        }\n        return "unknown";\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the image type is allowed.\n     * @return true if the image type is in the allowed list, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isAllowedImageType() {\n        for (String allowedType : ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES) {\n            if (allowedType.equalsIgnoreCase(this.imageType)) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the image size is within limits.\n     * @return true if size <= MAX_IMAGE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isSizeValid() {\n        return this.size <= MAX_IMAGE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the image dimensions are valid.\n     * Minimum dimensions required for a banner.\n     * @return true if width >= 300 and height >= 150, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean areDimensionsValid() {\n        return this.width >= 300 && this.height >= 150;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates the banner image against all criteria.\n     * @return true if all validations pass, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validate() {\n        return isAllowedImageType() && isSizeValid() && areDimensionsValid();\n    }\n    \n    // Getters\n    public String getImagePath() {\n        return imagePath;\n    }\n    \n    public long getSize() {\n        return size;\n    }\n    \n    public String getUploadedBy() {\n        return uploadedBy;\n    }\n    \n /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". imagePath, String uploadedBy) {\\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Image path cannot be null or empty.\\");\\n        }\\n        if (uploadedBy == null || uploadedBy.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Uploader ID cannot be null or empty.\\");\\n        }\\n        \\n        this.imagePath = imagePath;\\n        this.uploadedBy = uploadedBy;\\n        this.uploadDate = new Date();\\n        \\n        // Simulate image properties (in real app, these would be extracted from the image)\\n        this.size = (long) (Math.random() * 4 * 1024 * 1024) + 1024; // 1KB to 4MB\\n        this.imageType = extractImageType(imagePath);\\n        this.width = 800; // default width\\n        this.height = 600; // default height\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Extracts image type from the file path.\\n     * @param imagePath The path to the image\\n     * @return The image extension (lowercase) or \\"unknown\\" if not found\\n     */\\n    private String extractImageType(String imagePath) {\\n        if (imagePath == null) {\\n            return \\"unknown\\";\\n        }\\n        \\n        int lastDotIndex = imagePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < imagePath.length() - 1) {\\n            return imagePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1).toLowerCase();\\n        }\\n        return \\"unknown\\";\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the image type is allowed.\\n     * @return true if the image type is in the allowed list, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean isAllowedImageType() {\\n        for (String allowedType : ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES) {\\n            if (allowedType.equalsIgnoreCase(this.imageType)) {\\n                return true;\\n            }\\n        }\\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the image size is within limits.\\n     * @return true if size <= MAX_IMAGE_SIZE, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean isSizeValid() {\\n        return this.size <= MAX_IMAGE_SIZE;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the image dimensions are valid.\\n     * Minimum dimensions required for a banner.\\n     * @return true if width >= 300 and height >= 150, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean areDimensionsValid() {\\n        return this.width >= 300 && this.height >= 150;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates the banner image against all criteria.\\n     * @return true if all validations pass, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean validate() {\\n        return isAllowedImageType() && isSizeValid() && areDimensionsValid();\\n    }\\n    \\n    // Getters\\n    public String getImagePath() {\\n        return imagePath;\\n    }\\n    \\n    public long getSize() {\\n        return size;\\n    }\\n    \\n    public String getUploadedBy() {\\n        return uploadedBy;\\n    }\\n    \\n    public Date getUploadDate() {\\n        return uploadDate;\\n    }\\n    \\n    public String getImageType() {\\n        return imageType;\\n    }\\n    \\n    public int getWidth() {\\n        return width;\\n    }\\n    \\n    public int getHeight() {\\n        return height;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns a string representation of the banner.\\n     * @return Banner details\\n     */\\n    @Override\\n    public String toString() {\\n        return \\"Banner{\\" +\\n                \\"imagePath=\'\\" + imagePath + \'\\\\\'\' +\\n
