Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertBanner_1766834679/BannerManager.java has been successfully created, with content:
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Date;

/**
 * BannerManager class handles the business logic for banner insertion.
 * It coordinates between ImageValidator, RestaurantPoint, and other components
 * to ensure banners are inserted according to system requirements.
 * This class handles all error cases specified in the use case.
 */
public class BannerManager {
    
    private RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint;
    private List<Banner> insertedBanners;
    private List<String> operationLog;
    
    /**
     * Constructor for BannerManager.
     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banners will be managed
     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if restaurantPoint is null
     */
    public BannerManager(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {
        if (restaurantPoint == null) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("RestaurantPoint cannot be null");
        }
        
        this.restaurantPoint = restaurantPoint;
        this.insertedBanners = new ArrayList<>();
        this.operationLog = new ArrayList<>();
        
        logOperation("BannerManager initialized for restaurant point: " + 
                    restaurantPoint.getPointName() + " (ID: " + restaurantPoint.getPointId() + ")");
    }
    
    /**
     * Main method to insert a banner with full validation.
     * This method follows the use case flow:
     * 1. Validates the banner image
     * 2. Checks maximum banner limit
     * 3. Handles error cases appropriately
     * 
     * @param banner The banner to insert
     * @return true if banner was successfully inserted, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean insertBanner(Banner banner) {
        if (banner == null) {
            logOperation("Insertion failed: Banner is null");
            return false;
        }
        
        logOperation("Starting banner insertion process for image: " + banner.getImagePath());
        logOperation("Banner uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + 
                    " | Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes");
        
        // Step 1: Validate image characteristics
        if (!validateBannerImage(banner)) {
            logOperation("Insertion failed: Image validation failed for " + banner.getImagePath());
            System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics. Use case Errored triggered.");
            return false;
        }
        
        // Step 2: Check maximum banners condition
        if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {
            logOperation("Insertion failed: Maximum banners reached for restaurant point " + 
                        restaurantPoint.getPointId());
            System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + 
                             restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");
            System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");
            return false;
        }
        
        // Additional check: Ensure banner doesn't already exist (by image path)
        if (isBannerAlreadyExists(banner)) {
            logOperation("Insertion failed: Banner with same image path already exists: " + 
                        banner.getImagePath());
            System.out.println("Error: A banner with the same image already exists.");
            return false;
        }
        
        // Step 3: Insert the banner into restaurant point
        boolean added = restaurantPoint.addBanner(banner);
        
        if (added) {
            insertedBanners.add(banner);
            logOperation("Banner successfully inserted: " + banner.getImagePath());
            logOperation("Restaurant point now has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                        " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");
            
            // Step 4: Remember the banners (log to operation history)
            rememberBannerInsertion(banner);
            
            // Step 5: Notify about successful insertion
            notifyBannerInsertion(banner);
            
            return true;
        } else {
            logOperation("Insertion failed: Unknown error adding banner to restaurant point");
            System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner due to unknown error.");
            return false;
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Validates a banner's image using ImageValidator.
     * @param banner The banner to validate
     * @return true if validation passes, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean validateBannerImage(Banner banner) {
        try {
            logOperation("Validating banner image: " + banner.getImagePath());
            
            // Use ImageValidator to check image characteristics
            boolean isValid = ImageValidator.validate(banner);
            
            if (!isValid) {
                logOperation("Image validation failed for: " + banner.getImagePath());
                
                // Check specific validation failures for better error messages
                if (!banner.isAllowedImageType()) {
                    logOperation("Invalid image type: " + banner.getImageType());
                }
                if (!banner.isSizeValid()) {
                    logOperation("Invalid image size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes (max: " + 
                                ImageValidator.getMaxFileSize() + ")");
                }
                if (!banner.areDimensionsValid()) {
                    logOperation("Invalid image dimensions: " + banner.getWidth() + "x" + 
                                banner.getHeight() + " pixels (min: " + 
                                ImageValidator.getMinWidth() + "x" + 
                                ImageValidator.getMinHeight() + ")");
                }
            } else {
                logOperation("Image validation passed for: " + banner.getImagePath());
            }
            
            return isValid;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            logOperation("Image validation error: " + e.getMessage());
            return false;
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Checks if a banner with the same image path already exists.
     * @param banner The banner to check
     * @return true if a banner with same image path exists, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean isBannerAlreadyExists(Banner banner) {
        List<Banner> existingBanners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();
        
        for (Banner existingBanner : existingBanners) {
            if (existingBanner.getImagePath().equals(banner.getImagePath())) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        
        return false;
    }
    
    /**
     * Remembers the banner insertion by logging it to persistent storage.
     * In a real application, this would save to a database or file.
     * @param banner The banner that was inserted
     */
    private void rememberBannerInsertion(Banner banner) {
        String record = String.format(
            "Banner inserted at %s: Image='%s', UploadedBy='%s', RestaurantPoint='%s'",
            new Date(),
            banner.getImagePath(),
            banner.getUploadedBy(),
            restaurantPoint.getPointId()
        );
        
        logOperation("Remembering banner insertion: " + record);
        
        // In a real application, this would save to database or file system
        // For this demo, we just log it to the operation log
    }
    
    /**
     * Notifies about banner insertion.
     * In a real application, this might send notifications to users or other systems.
     * @param banner The banner that was inserted
     */
    private void notifyBannerInsertion(Banner banner) {
        String notification = String.format(
            "New banner inserted successfully!\n" +
            "Image: %s\n" +
            "Size: %s bytes\n" +
            "Uploaded by: %s\n" +
            "Restaurant point: %s (%s)\n" +
            "Current banners: %d/%d",
            banner.getImagePath(),
            banner.getSize(),
            banner.getUploadedBy(),
            restaurantPoint.getPointName(),
            restaurantPoint.getPointId(),
            restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount(),
            restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners()
        );
        
        logOperation("Sending notification: " + notification);
        
        // In a real application, this would send email, push notification, etc.
        // For this demo, we print to console
        System.out.println("\n=== NOTIFICATION ===");
        System.out.println(notification);
        System.out.println("====================\n");
    }
    
    /**
     * Logs an operation to the operation log.
     * @param message The operation message to log
     */
    private void logOperation(String message) {
        String timestamp = new Date().toString();
        String logEntry = String.format("[%s] %s", timestamp, message);
        operationLog.add(logEntry);
        
        // For debugging, also print to console
        System.out.println("[BannerManager] " + message);
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the current operation log.
     * @return List of operation log entries
     */
    public List<String> getOperationLog() {
        return new ArrayList<>(operationLog);
    }
    
    /**
     * Clears the operation log.
     */
    public void clearOperationLog() {
        operationLog.clear();
        logOperation("Operation log cleared");
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the number of banners inserted by this BannerManager instance.
     * @return Count of inserted banners
     */
    public int getInsertedBannerCount() {
        return insertedBanners.size();
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets all banners inserted by this BannerManager instance.
     * @return List of inserted banners
     */
    public List<Banner> getInsertedBanners() {
        return new ArrayList<>(insertedBanners);
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the restaurant point associated with this BannerManager.
     * @return The restaurant point
     */
    public RestaurantPoint getRestaurantPoint() {
        return restaurantPoint;
    }
    
    /**
     * Displays a summary of the banner management status.
     */
    public void displayStatus() {
        System.out.println("\n=== Banner Manager Status ===");
        System.out.println("Restaurant Point: " + restaurantPoint.getPointName() + 
                          " (ID: " + restaurantPoint.getPointId() + ")");
        System.out.println("Current banners: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                          " / " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
        System.out.println("Has reached max: " + restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners());
        System.out.println("Banners inserted by this manager: " + insertedBanners.size());
        System.out.println("Operation log entries: " + operationLog.size());
        System.out.println("=============================\n");
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates server connection check as per use case exit condition.
     * @return true if server is connected, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean checkServerConnection() {
        // In a real application, this would ping the server
        // For this demo, assume connection is usually available
        boolean isConnected = Math.random() > 0.15; // 85% chance of being connected
        
        if (!isConnected) {
            logOperation("Server connection check failed: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted");
            System.out.println("Exit condition: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");
        } else {
            logOperation("Server connection check passed");
        }
        
        return isConnected;
    }
    
    /**
     * Handles the "Errored" use case as specified in the requirements.
     * This method would be called when image validation fails.
     * @param banner The banner that caused the error
     * @param errorMessage Description of the error
     */
    public void handleErroredUseCase(Banner banner, String errorMessage) {
        logOperation("Errored use case triggered for banner: " + 
                    (banner != null ? banner.getImagePath() : "null"));
        logOperation("Error: " + errorMessage);
        
        System.out.println("\n=== ERROR HANDLING ===");
        System.out.println("Use case 'Errored' has been triggered.");
        System.out.println("Error details: " + errorMessage);
        if (banner != null) {
            System.out.println("Problematic banner: " + banner.getImagePath());
        }
        System.out.println("Please contact system administrator.");
        System.out.println("=====================\n");
        
        // In a real application, this might trigger error reporting, logging, etc.
    }
    
    /**
     * Simulates cancellation of operation by the operator.
     */
    public void simulateOperationCancellation() {
        logOperation("Operation cancelled by operator");
        System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Returns a string representation of the BannerManager.
     * @return String representation
     */
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "BannerManager{" +
                "restaurantPointId='" + restaurantPoint.getPointId() + '\'' +
                ", insertedBanners=" + insertedBanners.size() +
                ", operationLogEntries=" + operationLog.size() +
                '}';
    }
}

Exiting application.");\n            scanner.close();\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Create restaurant point (maximum 3 banners for demo)\n        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(3);\n        \n        // Create banner manager\n        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);\n        \n        // Create operator\n        Operator operator = new Operator("operator123");\n        \n        System.out.println("Authentication successful. Insert new banner");\n            System.out.println("2. View existing banners");\n            System.out.println("3. Exit");\n            System.out.print("Select option: ");\n            \n            int choice;\n            try {\n                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a number.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case 1:\n                    insertBannerFlow(operator, restaurantPoint, bannerManager, scanner);\n                    break;\n                case 2:\n                    displayBanners(restaurantPoint);\n                    break;\n                case 3:\n                    continueOperation = false;\n                    System.out.println("Exiting application.");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid option. Please try again.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        scanner.close();\n        System.out.println("Application terminated.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates operator authentication.\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     * @return true if authentication successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean authenticateOperator(Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Authentication Required ---");\n        System.out.print("Enter operator ID: ");\n        String operatorId = scanner.nextLine();\n        System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the main class InsertBannerApp.java. // Check image type/format\n        if (!isValidImageType(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image type for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image size\n        if (!isValidImageSize(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image size exceeds limit for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image dimensions\n        if (!isValidImageDimensions(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image dimensions for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Additional check: if image path is a file, verify file exists and is readable\n        if (!isImageAccessible(banner.getImagePath())) {\n            System.out.println("Validation warning: Image file may not be accessible at " + banner.getImagePath());\n            // Continue validation anyway as path might be a URL or in a different location\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file directly from file path.\n     * This is an alternative method that can be used when only the file path is available.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean validate(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image path is null or empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if file exists and is readable (for local files)\n        if (!isImageAccessible(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image file not accessible at " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        if (!hasValidExtension(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid file extension for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        if (!isValidFileSize(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: File size exceeds limit for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Note: Dimensions check would require image processing libraries\n        // For this simple implementation, we\'ll skip dimensions check for file path validation\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image type is allowed.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image type is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageType(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null || banner.getImageType() == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String imageType = banner.getImageType().toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(imageType);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageSize(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return banner.getSize() <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image dimensions are within allowed ranges.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if dimensions meet minimum requirements and don\'t exceed maximum, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageDimensions(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        int width = banner.getWidth();\n        int height = banner.getHeight();\n        \n        return width >= MIN_WIDTH && \n               height >= MIN_HEIGHT && \n               width <= MAX_WIDTH && \n               height <= MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if an image file at the given path exists and is readable.\n     * For URLs, this method returns true (URL validation would require network access).\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file exists and is readable (or is a URL), false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isImageAccessible(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a URL\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            // URL validation would require network connectivity check\n            // For simplicity, assume URLs are accessible\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a local file\n        Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n        File file = path.toFile();\n        \n        return file.exists() && file.isFile() && file.canRead();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file has a valid image extension.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if extension is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean hasValidExtension(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String extension = getFileExtension(imagePath).toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(extension);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Extracts file extension from a file path.\n     * \n     * @param filePath Path to the file\n     * @return File extension without the dot, or empty string if no extension\n     */\n    private static String getFileExtension(String filePath) {\n        if (filePath == null) {\n            return "";\n        }\n        \n        int lastDotIndex = filePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < filePath.length() - 1) {\n            return filePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1);\n        }\n        return "";\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidFileSize(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Skip size check for URLs (would require downloading)\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n            long fileSize = Files.size(path);\n            return fileSize <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error checking file size: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed file size in bytes.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum file size in bytes\n     */\n    public static long getMaxFileSize() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinWidth() {\n        return MIN_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinHeight() {\n        return MIN_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxWidth() {\n        return MAX_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxHeight() {\n        return MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed file extensions.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed extensions\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedExtensions() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed MIME types.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed MIME types\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedMimeTypes() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Formats file size in human-readable format.\n     * \n     * @param size File size in bytes\n     * @return Human-readable file size string\n     */\n    public static String formatFileSize(long size) {\n        if (size < 1024) {\n            return size + " bytes";\n        } else if (size < 1024 * 1024) {\n            return String.format("%.1f KB", size / 1024.0);\n        } else {\n            return String.format("%.1f MB", size / (1024.0 * 1024.0));\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays validation requirements for user information.\n     */\n    public static void displayValidationRequirements() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Image Validation Requirements System.out.println("Minimum dimensions: " + MIN_WIDTH + "x" + MIN_HEIGHT + " pixels");\n        System.out.println("Maximum dimensions: " + MAX_WIDTH + "x" + MAX_HEIGHT + " pixels");\n        System.out.println("-------------------------------------\\n");\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I can see that the ImageValidator class has been successfully created by Handles error cases appropriately\n     * \n     * @param banner The banner to insert\n     * @return true if banner was successfully inserted, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean insertBanner(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            logOperation("Insertion failed: Banner is null");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        logOperation("Starting banner insertion process for image: " + banner.getImagePath());\n        logOperation("Banner uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + \n                    " | Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes");\n        \n        // Step 1: Validate image characteristics\n        if (!validateBannerImage(banner)) {\n            logOperation("Insertion failed: Image validation failed for " + banner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics. System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the main class InsertBannerApp.java. java.nio.file.Files;\nimport java.nio.file.Path;\nimport java.nio.file.Paths;\nimport java.util.Arrays;\nimport java.util.HashSet;\nimport java.util.Set;\n\n/**\n * ImageValidator class provides static methods to validate image characteristics.\n * This class handles validation of image format, size, dimensions, and basic content checks.\n * It\'s used in the InsertBanner use case to ensure uploaded banners meet system requirements.\n */\npublic class ImageValidator {\n    \n    // Allowed image MIME types and extensions\n    private static final Set<String> ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\n        "image/jpeg", "image/jpg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"\n    ));\n    \n    private static final Set<String> ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\n        "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "gif", "webp"\n    ));\n    \n    // Maximum allowed file size in bytes (5MB)\n    private static final long MAX_FILE_SIZE = 5 * 1024 * 1024;\n    \n    // Minimum dimensions for banners\n    private static final int MIN_WIDTH = 300;\n    private static final int MIN_HEIGHT = 150;\n    \n    // Maximum dimensions for banners (optional constraint)\n    private static final int MAX_WIDTH = 1920;\n    private static final int MAX_HEIGHT = 1080;\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates a Banner object\'s image characteristics.\n     * This method performs multiple checks on the banner\'s image.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object to validate\n     * @return true if all validations pass, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean validate(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Banner is null");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image type/format\n        if (!isValidImageType(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image type for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image size\n        if (!isValidImageSize(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image size exceeds limit for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image dimensions\n        if (!isValidImageDimensions(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image dimensions for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Additional check: if image path is a file, verify file exists and is readable\n        if (!isImageAccessible(banner.getImagePath())) {\n            System.out.println("Validation warning: Image file may not be accessible at " + banner.getImagePath());\n            // Continue validation anyway as path might be a URL or in a different location\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file directly from file path.\n     * This is an alternative method that can be used when only the file path is available.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean validate(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image path is null or empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if file exists and is readable (for local files)\n        if (!isImageAccessible(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image file not accessible at " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        if (!hasValidExtension(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid file extension for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        if (!isValidFileSize(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: File size exceeds limit for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Note: Dimensions check would require image processing libraries\n        // For this simple implementation, we\'ll skip dimensions check for file path validation\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image type is allowed.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image type is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageType(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null || banner.getImageType() == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String imageType = banner.getImageType().toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(imageType);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageSize(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return banner.getSize() <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image dimensions are within allowed ranges.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if dimensions meet minimum requirements and don\'t exceed maximum, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageDimensions(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        int width = banner.getWidth();\n        int height = banner.getHeight();\n        \n        return width >= MIN_WIDTH && \n               height >= MIN_HEIGHT && \n               width <= MAX_WIDTH && \n               height <= MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if an image file at the given path exists and is readable.\n     * For URLs, this method returns true (URL validation would require network access).\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file exists and is readable (or is a URL), false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isImageAccessible(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a URL\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            // URL validation would require network connectivity check\n            // For simplicity, assume URLs are accessible\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a local file\n        Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n        File file = path.toFile();\n        \n        return file.exists() && file.isFile() && file.canRead();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file has a valid image extension.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if extension is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean hasValidExtension(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String extension = getFileExtension(imagePath).toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(extension);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Extracts file extension from a file path.\n     * \n     * @param filePath Path to the file\n     * @return File extension without the dot, or empty string if no extension\n     */\n    private static String getFileExtension(String filePath) {\n        if (filePath == null) {\n            return "";\n        }\n        \n        int lastDotIndex = filePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < filePath.length() - 1) {\n            return filePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1);\n        }\n        return "";\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidFileSize(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Skip size check for URLs (would require downloading)\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n            long fileSize = Files.size(path);\n            return fileSize <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error checking file size: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed file size in bytes.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum file size in bytes\n     */\n    public static long getMaxFileSize() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinWidth() {\n        return MIN_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinHeight() {\n        return MIN_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxWidth() {\n        return MAX_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxHeight() {\n        return MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed file extensions.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed extensions\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedExtensions() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed MIME types.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed MIME types\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedMimeTypes() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Formats file size in human-readable format.\n     * \n     * @param size File size in bytes\n     * @return Human-readable file size string\n     */\n    public static String formatFileSize(long size) {\n        if (size < 1024) {\n            return size + " bytes";\n        } else if (size < 1024 * 1024) {\n            return String.format("%.1f KB", size / 1024.0);\n        } else {\n            return String.format("%.1f MB", size / (1024.0 * 1024.0));\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where                            " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". to the image\\n     * @param uploadedBy ID of the operator who uploaded the image\\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if imagePath is null or empty\\n     */\\n    public Banner(String imagePath, String uploadedBy) {\\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Image path cannot be null or empty.\\");\\n        }\\n        if (uploadedBy == null || uploadedBy.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Uploader ID cannot be null or empty.\\");\\n        }\\n        \\n        this.imagePath = imagePath;\\n        this.uploadedBy = uploadedBy;\\n        this.uploadDate = new Date();\\n        \\n        // Simulate image properties (in real app, these would be extracted from the image)\\n        this.size = (long) (Math.random() * 4 * 1024 * 1024) + 1024; // 1KB to 4MB\\n        this.imageType = extractImageType(imagePath);\\n        this.width = 800; // default width\\n        this.height = 600; // default height\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Extracts image type from the file path.\\n     * @param imagePath The path to the image\\n     * @return The image extension (lowercase) or \\"unknown\\" if not found\\n     */\\n    private String extractImageType(String imagePath) {\\n        if (imagePath == null) {\\n            return \\"unknown\\";\\n        }\\n        \\n        int lastDotIndex = imagePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < imagePath.length() - 1) {\\n            return imagePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1).toLowerCase();\\n        }\\n        return \\"unknown\\";\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the image type is allowed.\\n     * @return true if the image type is in the allowed list, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean isAllowedImageType() {\\n        for (String allowedType : ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES) {\\n            if (allowedType.equalsIgnoreCase(this.imageType)) {\\n                return true;\\n            }\\n        }\\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the image size is within limits.\\n     * @return true if size <= MAX_IMAGE_SIZE, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean isSizeValid() {\\n        return this.size <= MAX_IMAGE_SIZE;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the image dimensions are valid.\\n     * Minimum dimensions required for a banner.\\n     * @return true if width >= 300 and height >= 150, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean areDimensionsValid() {\\n        return this.width >= 300 && this.height >= 150;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates the banner image against all criteria.\\n     * @return true if all validations pass, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean validate() {\\n        return isAllowedImageType() && isSizeValid() && areDimensionsValid();\\n    }\\n    \\n    // Getters\\n java.nio.file.Files;\nimport java.nio.file.Path;\nimport java.nio.file.Paths;\nimport java.util.Arrays;\nimport java.util.HashSet;\nimport java.util.Set;\n\n/**\n * ImageValidator class provides static methods to validate image characteristics.\n * This class handles validation of image format, size, dimensions, and basic content checks.\n * It\'s used in the InsertBanner use case to ensure uploaded banners meet system requirements.\n */\npublic class ImageValidator {\n    \n    // Allowed image MIME types and extensions\n    private static final Set<String> ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\n        "image/jpeg", "image/jpg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"\n    ));\n    \n    private static final Set<String> ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\n        "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "gif", "webp"\n    ));\n    \n    // Maximum allowed file size in bytes (5MB)\n    private static final long MAX_FILE_SIZE = 5 * 1024 * 1024;\n    \n    // Minimum dimensions for banners\n    private static final int MIN_WIDTH = 300;\n    private static final int MIN_HEIGHT = 150;\n    \n    // Maximum dimensions for banners (optional constraint)\n    private static final int MAX_WIDTH = 1920;\n    private static final int MAX_HEIGHT = 1080;\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates a Banner object\'s image characteristics.\n     * This method performs multiple checks on the banner\'s image.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object to validate\n     * @return true if all validations pass, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean validate(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Banner is null");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image type/format\n        if (!isValidImageType(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image type for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image size\n        if (!isValidImageSize(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image size exceeds limit for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image dimensions\n        if (!isValidImageDimensions(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image dimensions for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Additional check: if image path is a file, verify file exists and is readable\n        if (!isImageAccessible(banner.getImagePath())) {\n            System.out.println("Validation warning: Image file may not be accessible at " + banner.getImagePath());\n            // Continue validation anyway as path might be a URL or in a different location\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file directly from file path.\n     * This is an alternative method that can be used when only the file path is available.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean validate(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image path is null or empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if file exists and is readable (for local files)\n        if (!isImageAccessible(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image file not accessible at " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        if (!hasValidExtension(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid file extension for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        if (!isValidFileSize(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: File size exceeds limit for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Note: Dimensions check would require image processing libraries\n        // For this simple implementation, we\'ll skip dimensions check for file path validation\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image type is allowed.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image type is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageType(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null || banner.getImageType() == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String imageType = banner.getImageType().toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(imageType);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageSize(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return banner.getSize() <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image dimensions are within allowed ranges.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if dimensions meet minimum requirements and don\'t exceed maximum, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageDimensions(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        int width = banner.getWidth();\n        int height = banner.getHeight();\n        \n        return width >= MIN_WIDTH && \n               height >= MIN_HEIGHT && \n               width <= MAX_WIDTH && \n               height <= MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if an image file at the given path exists and is readable.\n     * For URLs, this method returns true (URL validation would require network access).\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file exists and is readable (or is a URL), false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isImageAccessible(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a URL\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            // URL validation would require network connectivity check\n            // For simplicity, assume URLs are accessible\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a local file\n        Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n        File file = path.toFile();\n        \n        return file.exists() && file.isFile() && file.canRead();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file has a valid image extension.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if extension is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean hasValidExtension(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String extension = getFileExtension(imagePath).toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(extension);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Extracts file extension from a file path.\n     * \n     * @param filePath Path to the file\n     * @return File extension without the dot, or empty string if no extension\n     */\n    private static String getFileExtension(String filePath) {\n        if (filePath == null) {\n            return "";\n        }\n        \n        int lastDotIndex = filePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < filePath.length() - 1) {\n            return filePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1);\n        }\n        return "";\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidFileSize(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Skip size check for URLs (would require downloading)\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n            long fileSize = Files.size(path);\n            return fileSize <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error checking file size: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed file size in bytes.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum file size in bytes\n     */\n    public static long getMaxFileSize() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinWidth() {\n        return MIN_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinHeight() {\n        return MIN_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxWidth() {\n        return MAX_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxHeight() {\n        return MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed file extensions.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed extensions\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedExtensions() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed MIME types.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed MIME types\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedMimeTypes() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Formats file size in human-readable format.\n     * \n     * @param size File size in bytes\n     * @return Human-readable file size string\n     */\n    public static String formatFileSize(long size) {\n        if (size < 1024) {\n            return size + " bytes";\n        } else if (size < 1024 * 1024) {\n            return String.format("%.1f KB", size / 1024.0);\n        } else {\n            return String.format("%.1f MB", size / (1024.0 * 1024.0));\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n System.out.println("-------------------------------------\\n");\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I can see that the ImageValidator class has been successfully created by
