import java.util.Scanner;

/**
 * Test class to demonstrate the InsertBanner program runs correctly.
 * This class showcases various scenarios and exit conditions from the use case.
 * It can be executed to verify the functionality of the InsertBanner system.
 */
public class InsertBannerTestDemo {
    
    /**
     * Main method to run the test demonstration.
     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== InsertBanner System Test Demonstration ===\n");
        
        // Test 1: Normal successful banner insertion
        System.out.println("Test 1: Normal successful banner insertion");
        testNormalInsertion();
        
        // Test 2: Maximum banners reached
        System.out.println("\nTest 2: Maximum banners reached (exit condition)");
        testMaxBannersReached();
        
        // Test 3: Invalid image characteristics (Errored use case)
        System.out.println("\nTest 3: Invalid image characteristics (Errored use case)");
        testInvalidImage();
        
        // Test 4: Operator cancels operation
        System.out.println("\nTest 4: Operator cancels operation (exit condition)");
        testOperatorCancellation();
        
        // Test 5: Server connection interruption
        System.out.println("\nTest 5: Server connection interruption (exit condition)");
        testServerConnectionInterruption();
        
        // Test 6: Multiple operations
        System.out.println("\nTest 6: Multiple banner insertions");
        testMultipleOperations();
        
        System.out.println("\n=== All tests completed ===");
        System.out.println("Note: This is a demonstration. In a real scenario,");
        System.out.println("these tests would be more comprehensive and automated.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Test normal successful banner insertion flow.
     * This simulates the happy path where everything works correctly.
     */
    private static void testNormalInsertion() {
        System.out.println("  Setting up test environment...");
        
        // Create restaurant point with capacity for 3 banners
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(3, "REST001", "Test Restaurant");
        
        // Create banner manager
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        
        // Create operator
        Operator operator = new Operator("OP001", "Test Operator", "op001@test.com", "REST001");
        
        // Simulate authentication
        operator.authenticate("password123");
        
        System.out.println("  Operator authenticated: " + operator.getOperatorId());
        System.out.println("  Restaurant point: " + restaurantPoint.getPointName());
        System.out.println("  Max banners: " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
        System.out.println("  Current banners: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount());
        
        // Create a valid banner
        Banner banner = new Banner("banner1.jpg", operator.getOperatorId());
        
        System.out.println("  Attempting to insert banner: " + banner.getImagePath());
        System.out.println("  Banner size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes");
        System.out.println("  Banner type: " + banner.getImageType());
        
        // Insert the banner
        boolean result = bannerManager.insertBanner(banner);
        
        if (result) {
            System.out.println("  ✓ SUCCESS: Banner inserted successfully");
            System.out.println("  Current banners: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                             "/" + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
        } else {
            System.out.println("  ✗ FAILED: Banner insertion failed");
        }
        
        // Display final status
        bannerManager.displayStatus();
    }
    
    /**
     * Test the exit condition where maximum banners are already reached.
     */
    private static void testMaxBannersReached() {
        System.out.println("  Setting up test with maximum banners...");
        
        // Create restaurant point with capacity for only 1 banner
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(1, "REST002", "Small Restaurant");
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        
        // Add one banner to reach maximum
        Banner firstBanner = new Banner("first.jpg", "OP001");
        restaurantPoint.addBanner(firstBanner);
        
        System.out.println("  Restaurant point already has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                         "/" + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners");
        System.out.println("  Has reached max: " + restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners());
        
        // Try to insert another banner
        Banner secondBanner = new Banner("second.jpg", "OP001");
        System.out.println("  Attempting to insert additional banner: " + secondBanner.getImagePath());
        
        boolean result = bannerManager.insertBanner(secondBanner);
        
        if (!result) {
            System.out.println("  ✓ SUCCESS: Correctly rejected insertion - maximum banners reached");
            System.out.println("  Exit condition triggered: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");
        } else {
            System.out.println("  ✗ FAILED: Should have rejected insertion due to max banners");
        }
        
        System.out.println("  Final banner count: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                         "/" + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
    }
    
    /**
     * Test the Errored use case when image characteristics are invalid.
     */
    private static void testInvalidImage() {
        System.out.println("  Testing invalid image validation...");
        
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(5, "REST003", "Test Restaurant");
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        
        // Create a banner with invalid characteristics
        // Note: In the actual Banner class, we can't directly set invalid properties
        // because they're randomly generated in constructor. For this test,
        // we'll rely on the ImageValidator's validation logic.
        
        // First, display validation requirements
        ImageValidator.displayValidationRequirements();
        
        // Create a banner with a file that has an invalid extension
        Banner invalidBanner = new Banner("invalid.exe", "OP001");
        
        System.out.println("  Testing banner with invalid extension: " + invalidBanner.getImagePath());
        System.out.println("  Banner type detected: " + invalidBanner.getImageType());
        
        // Check if banner validates itself
        boolean bannerSelfValidation = invalidBanner.validate();
        System.out.println("  Banner self-validation: " + (bannerSelfValidation ? "PASS" : "FAIL"));
        
        // Try to insert the invalid banner
        boolean result = bannerManager.insertBanner(invalidBanner);
        
        if (!result) {
            System.out.println("  ✓ SUCCESS: Correctly rejected invalid image");
            System.out.println("  Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");
        } else {
            System.out.println("  ✗ FAILED: Should have rejected invalid image");
        }
        
        // Test with ImageValidator directly
        System.out.println("  Direct ImageValidator test:");
        boolean validatorResult = ImageValidator.validate(invalidBanner);
        System.out.println("  ImageValidator result: " + (validatorResult ? "VALID" : "INVALID"));
    }
    
    /**
     * Test the exit condition where operator cancels the operation.
     */
    private static void testOperatorCancellation() {
        System.out.println("  Simulating operator cancellation...");
        
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(3, "REST004", "Cancellation Test");
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        
        // Simulate cancellation
        bannerManager.simulateOperationCancellation();
        
        System.out.println("  ✓ SUCCESS: Operator cancellation simulated");
        System.out.println("  Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");
        
        // Show that no banner was inserted
        System.out.println("  Current banners: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                         "/" + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
    }
    
    /**
     * Test the exit condition where server connection is interrupted.
     */
    private static void testServerConnectionInterruption() {
        System.out.println("  Testing server connection interruption...");
        
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(3, "REST005", "Server Test");
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        Operator operator = new Operator("OP005", "Server Test Operator", "op005@test.com", "REST005");
        
        // Test server connection through operator
        System.out.println("  Testing operator connection to ETOUR server...");
        boolean connected = operator.connectToEtourServer();
        
        if (!connected) {
            System.out.println("  ✓ SUCCESS: Server connection interruption simulated");
            System.out.println("  Exit condition: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");
        } else {
            System.out.println("  Note: Server connection successful (random chance in simulation)");
        }
        
        // Test server connection through banner manager
        System.out.println("  Testing banner manager server connection check...");
        boolean managerConnection = bannerManager.checkServerConnection();
        System.out.println("  Banner manager connection: " + (managerConnection ? "CONNECTED" : "INTERRUPTED"));
        
        // Test server connection through main app (simulate disconnection)
        System.out.println("  Testing main app server connection...");
        InsertBannerApp.simulateServerDisconnection();
        boolean appConnection = InsertBannerApp.checkServerConnection();
        System.out.println("  Main app connection after disconnection: " + (appConnection ? "CONNECTED" : "INTERRUPTED"));
        
        // Reconnect for other tests
        InsertBannerApp.simulateServerReconnection();
    }
    
    /**
     * Test multiple banner insertions to show system robustness.
     */
    private static void testMultipleOperations() {
        System.out.println("  Testing multiple operations...");
        
        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(5, "REST006", "Multi-Test Restaurant");
        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);
        Operator operator = new Operator("OP006", "Multi-Test Operator", "op006@test.com", "REST006");
        operator.authenticate("password");
        
        System.out.println("  Starting with empty restaurant point");
        System.out.println("  Max banners: " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
        System.out.println("  Current banners: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount());
        
        // Insert multiple banners
        String[] bannerFiles = {"banner1.jpg", "banner2.png", "banner3.gif", "banner4.jpg", "banner5.png"};
        int successCount = 0;
        int failCount = 0;
        
        for (int i = 0; i < bannerFiles.length; i++) {
            Banner banner = new Banner(bannerFiles[i], operator.getOperatorId());
            System.out.println("  Inserting banner " + (i + 1) + ": " + bannerFiles[i]);
            
            boolean result = bannerManager.insertBanner(banner);
            
            if (result) {
                successCount++;
                System.out.println("    ✓ Success");
            } else {
                failCount++;
                System.out.println("    ✗ Failed");
            }
            
            System.out.println("    Current: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + 
                             "/" + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());
        }
        
        System.out.println("  Summary:");
        System.out.println("    Successful insertions: " + successCount);
        System.out.println("    Failed insertions: " + failCount);
        System.out.println("    Total banners in system: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount());
        
        // Display all banners
        System.out.println("  All banners in restaurant point:");
        for (int i = 0; i < restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount(); i++) {
            Banner banner = restaurantPoint.getBanner(i);
            if (banner != null) {
                System.out.println("    " + (i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + 
                                 " (" + banner.getSize() + " bytes)");
            }
        }
        
        // Test banner retrieval
        System.out.println("  Testing banner retrieval methods:");
        System.out.println("    Has banners: " + restaurantPoint.hasBanners());
        System.out.println("    Remaining slots: " + restaurantPoint.getRemainingBannerSlots());
        
        // Test operation log
        System.out.println("  Operation log entries: " + bannerManager.getOperationLog().size());
        if (bannerManager.getOperationLog().size() > 0) {
            System.out.println("    Last operation: " + 
                             bannerManager.getOperationLog().get(bannerManager.getOperationLog().size() - 1));
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Helper method to simulate user input for testing.
     * This is used to demonstrate how the main application would work.
     */
    private static void simulateUserInputTest() {
        System.out.println("\n=== Simulating User Input Test ===");
        System.out.println("This demonstrates how the main InsertBannerApp would work with user input.");
        System.out.println("(In a real test, we would use a mocking framework or simulated input)");
        
        // Note: In a real unit test, we would use JUnit with mocked Scanner
        // For this demonstration, we just show the concept
        
        System.out.println("Simulated steps:");
        System.out.println("1. User selects 'Insert new banner'");
        System.out.println("2. System displays image selection form");
        System.out.println("3. User enters 'test_banner.jpg'");
        System.out.println("4. System validates image");
        System.out.println("5. System checks maximum banners");
        System.out.println("6. System asks for confirmation");
        System.out.println("7. User confirms 'yes'");
        System.out.println("8. System inserts banner and notifies user");
        
        System.out.println("=== End Simulation ===\n");
    }
}

Exiting application.");\n            scanner.close();\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Create restaurant point (maximum 3 banners for demo)\n        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(3);\n        \n        // Create banner manager\n        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);\n        \n        // Create operator\n        Operator operator = new Operator("operator123");\n        \n        System.out.println("Authentication successful. Insert new banner");\n            System.out.println("2. View existing banners");\n            System.out.println("3. Exit");\n            System.out.print("Select option: ");\n            \n            int choice;\n            try {\n                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a number.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case 1:\n                    insertBannerFlow(operator, restaurantPoint, bannerManager, scanner);\n                    break;\n                case 2:\n                    displayBanners(restaurantPoint);\n                    break;\n                case 3:\n                    continueOperation = false;\n                    System.out.println("Exiting application.");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid option. Please try again.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        scanner.close();\n        System.out.println("Application terminated.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates operator authentication.\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     * @return true if authentication successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean authenticateOperator(Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Authentication Required ---");\n        System.out.print("Enter operator ID: ");\n        String operatorId = scanner.nextLine();\n        System.out.print("Enter password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Simple authentication (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)\n        if (operatorId != null && !operatorId.trim().isEmpty() && \n            password != null && !password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main flow for inserting a banner.\n     * Follows the use case steps exactly.\n     * @param operator The authenticated operator\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point where banner will be added\n     * @param bannerManager Banner manager for handling insertion logic\n     * @param scanner Scanner for user input\n     */\n    private static void insertBannerFlow(Operator operator, RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint, \n                                        BannerManager bannerManager, Scanner scanner) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Insert Banner Flow ---");\n        \n        // Step 1 & 2: Feature selected, display form for image selection\n        System.out.println("Please select an image for the banner.");\n        \n        // Step 3: Select an image (simulate by entering image path/URL)\n        System.out.print("Enter image path or URL: ");\n        String imagePath = scanner.nextLine();\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition: Interruption of connection)\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            System.out.println("Exit condition met: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate image and check maximum banners\n        try {\n            // Create a banner object with the selected image\n            Banner newBanner = new Banner(imagePath, operator.getOperatorId());\n            \n            // Validate image characteristics\n            if (!ImageValidator.validate(newBanner)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid image characteristics.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Check maximum banners condition\n            if (restaurantPoint.hasReachedMaxBanners()) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Restaurant point has reached maximum allowed banners (" + \n                                 restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + ").");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The point has already entered the maximum number of banners allowed.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nBanner details:");\n            System.out.println("Image: " + newBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.println("Size: " + newBanner.getSize() + " bytes");\n            System.out.println("Uploaded by: " + newBanner.getUploadedBy());\n            System.out.println("Restaurant point currently has " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             " out of " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n            \n            System.out.print("\\nDo you want to insert this banner? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine();\n            \n            // Step 5: Confirm operation\n            if (!confirmation.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The Point Of Operator Restaurant cancels the operation.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Step 6: Insert the banner\n            boolean success = bannerManager.insertBanner(newBanner);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Success: New banner inserted!");\n                System.out.println("Exit condition: The notification about the insertion of new banner.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to insert banner.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error processing image: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Use case Errored triggered.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all banners associated with the restaurant point.\n     * @param restaurantPoint The restaurant point\n     */\n    private static void displayBanners(RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Current Banners for Restaurant Point ---");\n        List<Banner> banners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No banners found.");\n        } else {\n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (Size: " + banner.getSize() + " bytes, " +\n                                 "Uploaded by: " + banner.getUploadedBy() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("Total: " + banners.size() + " out of " + \n                         restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners() + " banners.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates checking server connection.\n     * In a real application, this would ping the server.\n     * @return true if server is reachable, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // Simulate server connection check\n        if (!isServerConnected) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // For demo, simulate occasional connection failures\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) { // 10% chance of connection failure for demo\n            isServerConnected = false;\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server disconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Method to simulate server reconnection (for testing).\n     */\n    public static void simulateServerReconnection() {\n        isServerConnected = true;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the main class InsertBannerApp.java. // Check image type/format\n        if (!isValidImageType(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image type for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image size\n        if (!isValidImageSize(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image size exceeds limit for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image dimensions\n        if (!isValidImageDimensions(banner)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid image dimensions for banner " + banner.getImagePath());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Additional check: if image path is a file, verify file exists and is readable\n        if (!isImageAccessible(banner.getImagePath())) {\n            System.out.println("Validation warning: Image file may not be accessible at " + banner.getImagePath());\n            // Continue validation anyway as path might be a URL or in a different location\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file directly from file path.\n     * This is an alternative method that can be used when only the file path is available.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean validate(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image path is null or empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if file exists and is readable (for local files)\n        if (!isImageAccessible(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Image file not accessible at " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        if (!hasValidExtension(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: Invalid file extension for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        if (!isValidFileSize(imagePath)) {\n            System.out.println("Validation failed: File size exceeds limit for " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Note: Dimensions check would require image processing libraries\n        // For this simple implementation, we\'ll skip dimensions check for file path validation\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image type is allowed.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image type is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageType(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null || banner.getImageType() == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String imageType = banner.getImageType().toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(imageType);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if image size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageSize(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return banner.getSize() <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the banner\'s image dimensions are within allowed ranges.\n     * \n     * @param banner The Banner object\n     * @return true if dimensions meet minimum requirements and don\'t exceed maximum, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidImageDimensions(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        int width = banner.getWidth();\n        int height = banner.getHeight();\n        \n        return width >= MIN_WIDTH && \n               height >= MIN_HEIGHT && \n               width <= MAX_WIDTH && \n               height <= MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if an image file at the given path exists and is readable.\n     * For URLs, this method returns true (URL validation would require network access).\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file exists and is readable (or is a URL), false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isImageAccessible(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a URL\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            // URL validation would require network connectivity check\n            // For simplicity, assume URLs are accessible\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if path is a local file\n        Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n        File file = path.toFile();\n        \n        return file.exists() && file.isFile() && file.canRead();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file has a valid image extension.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if extension is in allowed set, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean hasValidExtension(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String extension = getFileExtension(imagePath).toLowerCase();\n        return ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS.contains(extension);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Extracts file extension from a file path.\n     * \n     * @param filePath Path to the file\n     * @return File extension without the dot, or empty string if no extension\n     */\n    private static String getFileExtension(String filePath) {\n        if (filePath == null) {\n            return "";\n        }\n        \n        int lastDotIndex = filePath.lastIndexOf(\'.\');\n        if (lastDotIndex > 0 && lastDotIndex < filePath.length() - 1) {\n            return filePath.substring(lastDotIndex + 1);\n        }\n        return "";\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the file size is within allowed limits.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if file size <= MAX_FILE_SIZE, false otherwise\n     */\n    private static boolean isValidFileSize(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Skip size check for URLs (would require downloading)\n        if (imagePath.startsWith("http://") || imagePath.startsWith("https://")) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Path path = Paths.get(imagePath);\n            long fileSize = Files.size(path);\n            return fileSize <= MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error checking file size: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed file size in bytes.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum file size in bytes\n     */\n    public static long getMaxFileSize() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinWidth() {\n        return MIN_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the minimum required height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Minimum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMinHeight() {\n        return MIN_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed width for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum width in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxWidth() {\n        return MAX_WIDTH;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns the maximum allowed height for banners.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum height in pixels\n     */\n    public static int getMaxHeight() {\n        return MAX_HEIGHT;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed file extensions.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed extensions\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedExtensions() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a set of allowed MIME types.\n     * \n     * @return Set of allowed MIME types\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getAllowedMimeTypes() {\n        return new HashSet<>(ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Formats file size in human-readable format.\n     * \n     * @param size File size in bytes\n     * @return Human-readable file size string\n     */\n    public static String formatFileSize(long size) {\n        if (size < 1024) {\n            return size + " bytes";\n        } else if (size < 1024 * 1024) {\n            return String.format("%.1f KB", size / 1024.0);\n        } else {\n            return String.format("%.1f MB", size / (1024.0 * 1024.0));\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays validation requirements for user information.\n     */\n    public static void displayValidationRequirements() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Image Validation Requirements ---");\n        System.out.println("Allowed formats: " + String.join(", ", ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS));\n        System.out.println("Maximum file size: " + formatFileSize(MAX_FILE_SIZE));\n        System.out.println("Minimum dimensions: " + MIN_WIDTH + "x" + MIN_HEIGHT + " pixels");\n        System.out.println("Maximum dimensions: " + MAX_WIDTH + "x" + MAX_HEIGHT + " pixels");\n        System.out.println("-------------------------------------\\n");\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I can see that the ImageValidator class has been successfully created by private boolean isBannerAlreadyExists(Banner banner) {\n        List<Banner> existingBanners = restaurantPoint.getBanners();\n        \n        for (Banner existingBanner : existingBanners) {\n public Operator(String operatorId, String name, String email, String restaurantPointId) {\n        if (operatorId == null || operatorId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (email == null || email.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Operator email cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n : null;\n        this.authenticated = false;\n        this.authenticationTime = null;\n        this.lastActivityTime = new Date(); // Set to current time on creation\n        this.permissions = new HashSet<>();\n        this.sessionId = -1; // No active session until authenticated\n        \n        // Add default permissions\n        addDefaultPermissions();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simplified constructor for demo purposes.\n     * Creates an operator with minimal information.\n     * \n     * @param operatorId Unique identifier for the operator\n     */\n    public Operator(String operatorId) {\n        this(operatorId, "Operator " + operatorId, operatorId + "@restaurant.com", null);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds default permissions for a restaurant point operator.\n     * In a real application, permissions would be loaded from a database or configuration.\n     */\n    private void addDefaultPermissions() {\n        permissions.add(PERMISSION_INSERT_BANNER);\n        permissions.add(PERMISSION_VIEW_BANNERS);\n        permissions.add(PERMISSION_MANAGE_RESTAURANT);\n        // Note: DELETE_BANNER is not a default permission\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Authenticates the operator with provided credentials.\n     * In a real application, this would verify against a database or authentication service.\n     * \n     * @param password The password to authenticate with\n     * @return true if authentication successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean authenticate(String password) {\n        if (password == null || password.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Authentication failed: Password cannot be empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate authentication (in real app, this would hash and compare passwords)\n        // For demo purposes, accept any non-empty password\n        boolean authSuccessful = !password.trim().isEmpty();\n        \n        if (authSuccessful) {\n            this.authenticated = true;\n            this.authenticationTime = new Date();\n            this.lastActivityTime = new Date();\n            this.sessionId = nextSessionId++;\n            \n            System.out.println("Operator " + operatorId + " authenticated successfully.");\n            System.out.println("Session ID: " + sessionId);\n            System.out.println("Authentication time: " + authenticationTime);\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Authentication failed for operator " + operatorId);\n        }\n        \n        return authSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the operator, ending the current session.\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        if (authenticated) {\n            System.out.println("Operator " + operatorId + " logged out.");\n            System.out.println("Session " + sessionId + " ended.");\n            \n            this.authenticated = false;\n            this.sessionId = -1;\n            updateLastActivityTime();\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Operator " + operatorId + " is not currently authenticated.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\n     * \n     * @param permission The permission to check\n     * @return true if operator has the permission, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\n        if (permission == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        return permissions.contains(permission);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a permission to the operator\'s permission set.\n     * \n     * @param permission The permission to add\n     * @return true if permission was added, false if already present\n     */\n    public boolean addPermission(String permission) {\n        if (permission == null || permission.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        return permissions.add(permission.trim());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Removes a permission from the operator\'s permission set.\n     * \n     * @param permission The permission to remove\n     * @return true if permission was removed, false if not present\n     */\n    public boolean removePermission(String permission) {\n        if (permission == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        return permissions.remove(permission);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Updates the last activity time to the current time.\n     * This should be called whenever the operator performs an action.\n     */\n    public void updateLastActivityTime() {\n        this.lastActivityTime = new Date();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the operator\'s session has expired.\n     * Sessions expire after 30 minutes of inactivity.\n     * \n     * @return true if session has expired, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isSessionExpired() {\n        if (!authenticated || authenticationTime == null || lastActivityTime == null) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();\n        long lastActivity = lastActivityTime.getTime();\n        long sessionTimeout = 30 * 60 * 1000; // 30 minutes in milliseconds\n        \n        return (currentTime - lastActivity) > sessionTimeout;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the operator is currently authenticated and the session is valid.\n     * Automatically checks for session expiration.\n     * \n     * @return true if operator is properly authenticated with a valid session, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isAuthenticated() {\n        if (authenticated && isSessionExpired()) {\n            System.out.println("Session expired for operator " + operatorId);\n            authenticated = false;\n            sessionId = -1;\n        }\n        return authenticated;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates that the operator has the required permission for an operation.\n     * Updates last activity time if validation passes.\n     * \n     * @param permission The required permission\n     * @return true if operator is authenticated and has the permission, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validatePermission(String permission) {\n        updateLastActivityTime();\n        \n        if (!isAuthenticated()) {\n            System.out.println("Permission validation failed: Operator " + operatorId + " is not authenticated.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!hasPermission(permission)) {\n            System.out.println("Permission validation failed: Operator " + operatorId + \n                             " lacks permission: " + permission);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates connection to the ETOUR server.\n     * Based on the use case exit condition "Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR".\n     * \n     * @return true if connection is successful, false if interrupted\n     */\n    public boolean connectToEtourServer() {\n        updateLastActivityTime();\n        \n        // Simulate occasional connection failures (10% chance)\n        boolean connected = Math.random() > 0.1;\n        \n        if (!connected) {\n            System.out.println("Connection to ETOUR server interrupted for operator " + operatorId);\n            System.out.println("Exit condition: Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR.");\n        }\n        \n        return connected;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator\'s unique identifier.\n     * \n     * @return Operator ID\n     */\n    public String getOperatorId() {\n        return operatorId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator\'s full name.\n     * \n     * @return Operator name\n     */\n    public String getName() {\n        return name;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator\'s email address.\n     * \n     * @return Operator email\n     */\n    public String getEmail() {\n        return email;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the time when the operator was authenticated.\n     * \n     * @return Authentication time, or null if not authenticated\n     */\n    public Date getAuthenticationTime() {\n        return authenticationTime != null ? (Date) authenticationTime.clone() : null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the time of the operator\'s last activity.\n     * \n     * @return Last activity time\n     */\n    public Date getLastActivityTime() {\n        return (Date) lastActivityTime.clone();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator\'s permissions.\n     * \n     * @return Set of permissions (unmodifiable)\n     */\n    public Set<String> getPermissions() {\n        return new HashSet<>(permissions);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the ID of the restaurant point this operator manages.\n     * \n     * @return Restaurant point ID, or null if not assigned\n     */\n    public String getRestaurantPointId() {\n        return restaurantPointId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sets the restaurant point this operator manages.\n     * \n     * @param restaurantPointId The restaurant point ID\n     */\n    public void setRestaurantPointId(String restaurantPointId) {\n        this.restaurantPointId = restaurantPointId != null ? restaurantPointId.trim() : null;\n        updateLastActivityTime();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current session ID.\n     * \n     * @return Session ID, or -1 if not authenticated\n     */\n    public int getSessionId() {\n        return sessionId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the session timeout in milliseconds.\n     * \n     * @return Session timeout (30 minutes)\n     */\n    public long getSessionTimeout() {\n        return 30 * 60 * 1000; // 30 minutes in milliseconds\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Calculates the remaining session time in milliseconds.\n     * \n     * @return Remaining session time, or 0 if not authenticated or session expired\n     */\n    public long getRemainingSessionTime() {\n        if (!authenticated || lastActivityTime == null) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        \n        long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();\n        long lastActivity = lastActivityTime.getTime();\n        long elapsed = currentTime - lastActivity;\n        long timeout = getSessionTimeout();\n        \n        return Math.max(0, timeout - elapsed);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Formats remaining session time in a human-readable format.\n     * \n     * @return Formatted session time (e.g., "15 minutes, 30 seconds")\n     */\n    public String getFormattedRemainingSessionTime() {\n        long remainingMillis = getRemainingSessionTime();\n        \n        if (remainingMillis <= 0) {\n            return "Session expired or not authenticated";\n        }\n        \n        long minutes = remainingMillis / (60 * 1000);\n        long seconds = (remainingMillis % (60 * 1000)) / 1000;\n        \n        if (minutes > 0) {\n            return String.format("%d minutes, %d seconds", minutes, seconds);\n        } else {\n            return String.format("%d seconds", seconds);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the operator.\n     * \n     * @return Operator details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return "Operator{" +\n                "operatorId=\'" + operatorId + \'\\\'\' +\n                ", name=\'" + name + \'\\\'\' +\n                ", authenticated=" + authenticated +\n                ", sessionId=" + sessionId +\n                ", restaurantPointId=\'" + restaurantPointId + \'\\\'\' +\n                ", permissions=" + permissions.size() +\n                \'}\';\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays operator information and status.\n     */\n    public void displayStatus() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Operator Status ===");\n        System.out.println("ID: " + operatorId);\n        System.out.println("Name: " + name);\n        System.out.println("Email: " + email);\n        System.out.println("Authenticated: " + (authenticated ? "Yes" : "No"));\n        System.out.println("Session ID: " + (sessionId != -1 ? sessionId : "None"));\n        \n        if (authenticated) {\n            System.out.println("Authentication Time: " + authenticationTime);\n            System.out.println("Last Activity: " + lastActivityTime);\n            System.out.println("Session Timeout: " + getFormattedRemainingSessionTime());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Restaurant Point: " + (restaurantPointId != null ? restaurantPointId : "Not assigned"));\n        System.out.println("Permissions: " + permissions.size() + " total");\n        System.out.println("======================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method for testing the Operator class (not used in production).\n     * This would be removed or moved to a separate test class in a real application.\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        // Test the Operator class\n        Operator operator = new Operator("OP001", "John Doe", "john@restaurant.com", "REST001");\n        operator.displayStatus();\n        \n        // Test authentication\n        System.out.println("Authenticating with password \'test123\'...");\n        boolean authResult = operator.authenticate("test123");\n        System.out.println("Authentication result: " + (authResult ? "CONNECTED" : "INTERRUPTED"));\n        \n        // Reconnect for other tests\n        InsertBannerApp.simulateServerReconnection();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Test multiple banner insertions to show system robustness.\n     */\n    private static void testMultipleOperations() {\n        System.out.println("  Testing multiple operations...");\n        \n        RestaurantPoint restaurantPoint = new RestaurantPoint(5, "REST006", "Multi-Test Restaurant");\n        BannerManager bannerManager = new BannerManager(restaurantPoint);\n        Operator operator = new Operator("OP006", "Multi-Test Operator", "op006@test.com", "REST006");\n        operator.authenticate("password");\n        \n        System.out.println("  Starting with empty restaurant point");\n        System.out.println("  Max banners: " + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());\n        System.out.println("  Current banners: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount());\n        \n        // Insert multiple banners\n        String[] bannerFiles = {"banner1.jpg", "banner2.png", "banner3.gif", "banner4.jpg", "banner5.png"};\n        int successCount = 0;\n        int failCount = 0;\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < bannerFiles.length; i++) {\n            Banner banner = new Banner(bannerFiles[i], operator.getOperatorId());\n            System.out.println("  Inserting banner " + (i + 1) + ": " + bannerFiles[i]);\n            \n            boolean result = bannerManager.insertBanner(banner);\n            \n            if (result) {\n                successCount++;\n                System.out.println("    ✓ Success");\n            } else {\n                failCount++;\n                System.out.println("    ✗ Failed");\n            }\n            \n            System.out.println("    Current: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount() + \n                             "/" + restaurantPoint.getMaxBanners());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("  Summary:");\n        System.out.println("    Successful insertions: " + successCount);\n        System.out.println("    Failed insertions: " + failCount);\n        System.out.println("    Total banners in system: " + restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount());\n        \n        // Display all banners\n        System.out.println("  All banners in restaurant point:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < restaurantPoint.getCurrentBannerCount(); i++) {\n            Banner banner = restaurantPoint.getBanner(i);\n            if (banner != null) {\n                System.out.println("    " + (i + 1) + ". " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 " (" + banner.getSize() + " bytes)");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Test banner retrieval\n        System.out.println("  Testing banner retrieval methods:");\n        System.out.println("    Has banners: " + restaurantPoint.hasBanners());\n        System.out.println("    Remaining slots: " + restaurantPoint.getRemainingBannerSlots());\n        \n        // Test operation log\n        System.out.println("  Operation log entries: " + bannerManager.getOperationLog().size());\n        if (bannerManager.getOperationLog().size() > 0) {\n            System.out.println("    Last operation: " + \n                             bannerManager.getOperationLog().get(bannerManager.getOperationLog().size() - 1));\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Helper method to simulate user input for testing.\n     * This is used to demonstrate how the main application would work.\n     */\n    private static void simulateUserInputTest() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Simulating User Input Test ===");\n        System.out.println("This demonstrates how the main InsertBannerApp would work with user input.");\n        System.out.println("(In a real test, we would use a mocking framework or simulated input)");\n        \n        // Note: In a real unit test, we would use JUnit with mocked Scanner\n        // For this demonstration, we just show the concept\n        \n        System.out.println("Simulated steps:");\n        System.out.println("1.
